headline: Microsoft Stock Approaches This Early Entry Point; Is MSFT A Buy In January?
summary: Microsoft started the new year with a small gain year to date, then lost it in recent weeks.  This story will assess fundamental, technical and institutional sponsorship criteria on the veteran tech giant and long-term leader of the stock market.  Following the three-day MLK national holiday, the leader in cloud computing, enterprise software, gaming consoles and computing hardware underperformed a broad and bullish stock market advance, edging 0.1% lower on Tuesday to 428.50 in above-average turnover.

This story will assess fundamental, technical and institutional sponsorship criteria on the veteran tech giant and long-term leader of the stock market.  Following the three-day MLK national holiday, the leader in cloud computing, enterprise software, gaming consoles and computing hardware underperformed a broad and bullish stock market advance, edging 0.1% lower on Tuesday to 428.50 in above-average turnover.

headline: Big Tech faces key earnings test
summary: Following the surge in Big Tech stocks after President Trump's $100 billion Stargate venture announcement, the next key event for the sector is earnings season, kicking off on January 29th with major names like Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), and Meta (META). Catalysts Anchor Madison Mills takes a look at earnings expectations for Big Tech. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: Salesforce's AI Agents Pivot Is Already Showing Results
summary: For the quarter ended on October 31st, Salesforce (NYSE: CRM) reported that revenue grew 8% YoY to $9.44 billion, surpassing LSEG’s consensus estimate of $9.34 billion. Net income grew 25% YoY to $1.5 billion. Adjusted earnings of $2.41 per share which came short of LSEG’s estimate of $2.44. Fiscal fourth quarter guidance Salesforce guided for current quarter sales between $9.9 billion and $10.10 billion and earnings per share in the range between $2.57 and $2.62. headline: Bill Gates Memorized License Plates Of 'Everybody' At Microsoft – Then Checked The Parking Lot To See Who Was Working: 'I Was Quite Fanatical'
summary: When you hold the title of richest man in the world for 18 years, you will have a few quirks. Bill Gates, the cofounder of Microsoft, may now be known for his philanthropy and thoughtful demeanor. Still, in the early days of building his tech empire, he was something else entirely – a self-described workaholic with an almost obsessive attention to detail.
